objects.description:
IPCop 2.0.2 - i486 - CD.
The IPCop Firewall is a Linux firewall distribution.
objects.install_notes:
1. Attach the CD.
 Please be aware that the CD needs to be attached to the server to IDE. 
 
 2. Attach a Drive.
 Please be aware that the minimum drive size where you are going to install the OS should be 5 GB. 
 
 3. Connecting to your server via VNC.
 a) Having installed a compatible VNC client, open a VNC connection to your server through the UI. 
 b) Enter your VNC url and VNC password as displayed on your Server Properties Window. 
 c) Start to configure your server. 
 
 4. Minimum Hardware Requirements.
 The recommended minimum hardware requirements as publishes by ipcop.org are: 32MB RAM and 386MHz CPU 
 We recommend specifying a higher level of RAM for a better user experience.
objects.name: IPCop 2.0.2

objects.install_notes:
1. Attach the CD 
 Please be aware that the CD needs to be attached to the server to IDE. 
 
 2. Attach a Drive 
 Please be aware that the minimum drive size where you are going to install the OS should be 32 GB. 
 
 3. Connecting to your server via VNC 
 a) Having installed a compatible VNC client, open a VNC connection to your server through the UI. 
 b) Enter your VNC url and VNC password as displayed on your Server Properties Window. 
 c) Start to configure your server. 
 
 4. Minimum Hardware Requirements 
 The recommended minimum hardware requirements as publishes by Microsoft can be found through the following link: http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn303418.aspx We recommend specifying a higher level of RAM for a better user experience. 
 
 5. Enter your license key.
objects.name: Windows Server Standard 2012

objects.description: CentOS 6.4 Server - amd64 Pre-Installed English with SSH and VirtIO support. Last update on 2013/09/30.
objects.install_notes:
1. Clone the Image.

The image needs to be cloned and then attached to the server.



2. Connecting to your server via VNC.

a) Having installed a compatible VNC client, open a VNC connection to your server through the UI.

b) Enter your VNC url and VNC password as displayed on your Server Properties Window.

c) Start to configure your server.



3. Minimum Hardware Requirements.

The recommended minimum hardware requirements as publishes by centos.org: 0.5GB RAM and 0.5GHz CPU



4. Update your administrator password.

By default and for security reasons "root" login is completely disabled (including for ssh)

User "cloudsigma" with password "cloudsigma" is available for access.

Please be aware that on the first login you will be asked to change the current password "cloudsigma" and set a secure password.

For "root" please use the command "sudo su"



5. Setup your CentOS.



6. Configuring your Networking.

a) IP networking can be left as DHCP. Even if you are using a static IP address with this server our management layer will assign the same IP address via DHCP. Using DHCP ensures you will have no issues receiving the correct networking settings. We recommend using DHCP initially if only to receive all the correct networking settings.

b) CloudSigma employs an open networking infrastructure. All ports are open for inbound and outbound traffic with the exception of port 25 (SMTP) which is blocked for trial users. It is important that you secure access to your server according to your needs.
objects.name: CentOS 6.4 Server

objects.description: Debian 6.0.7 - amd64 Pre-Installed English with SSH and VirtIO support. Last update on 2013/09/28.
objects.install_notes:
Intall notes:	1. Clone the Image. 
 The image needs to be cloned and then attached to the server. 
 
 2. Connecting to your server via VNC. 
 a) Having installed a compatible VNC client, open a VNC connection to your server through the UI. 
 b) Enter your VNC url and VNC password as displayed on your Server Properties Window. 
 c) Start to configure your server. 
 
 3. Minimum Hardware Requirements. 
 The recommended minimum hardware requirements as publishes by Debian.org: 1GB RAM and 1GHrz CPU 
 
 4. Update your administrator password. 
 Please be aware that on startup you will be asked to enter the current password "password123" and set a secure password. 
 
 5. Setup your Debian. 
 By default the timezone and the language are set to Switzerland. 
 
 6. Configuring your Networking. 
 a) IP networking can be left as DHCP. Even if you are using a static IP address with this server our management layer will apply the same IP address via DHCP. Using DHCP ensures you will have no issues receiving the correct networking settings. We recommend using DHCP initially if only to receive all the correct networking settings. 
 b) CloudSigma employs an open networking infrastructure. All ports are open for inbound and outbound traffic with the exception of port 25 (SMTP) which is blocked for trial users. It is important that you secure access to your server according to your needs.
objects.name: Debian 6.0.7 Desktop
